name: The Last Bastion of Chinese Socialism
description: The Central Revolutionary Base, situated in highlands between Jiangxi and Fujian province, is one of the last points of concentrated socialist resistance in China. The National Revolutionary Army's shattered remnants rallied here after the 1932 Shanghai uprising, clinging to the dim hope of a free nation. The years have not always been kind to us, thousands of good comrades have been martyred. But we hold on, even as League encirclement campaigns seem to grow closer each year...

name: Return of the Second NRA
description: Once believed to be the army capable of unifying China, the National Revolutionary Army split apart during the fallout of the Northern Expedition. After nearly a decade of fighting the guerrilla war in the MinGan Zone, the NRA has returned with its full strength - hoping to carry out one last uprising for salvation.

name: Fortify the MinGan Zone
description: For years, we have familiarised ourselves with the mountains and forests of the Jiangxi and Fujian  region - turning our exile into the bulwark of a new national revolution. With open revolt once more underway, it will do us well to ensure that our defences and fortifications are adequately prepared and hidden for the enemy's onslaught.

name: Rally the Militias!
description: Since the widow of our late founder, Song Qingling established the MinGan Insurgency - the leading officers and generals of the NRA in China have been tasked in training and educating the peasants to organise themselves into revolutionary militias. If the Chinese people are to transition to a state of democracy, then we must encourage the militias to defend this freedom.

name: Encourage our Revolutionary Sisters
description: Taking the example of the great revolutionary Song Qingling, thousands of women serve in the MinGan Insurgent Zone as teachers, nurses, writers, and volunteers - all eager to not only win freedom for China but also to achieve equality for all sexes in the ensuring revolution. Let us encourage the creation of a woman's volunteer unit to aid in our struggle.

name: Enforce Discipline
description: As the NRA finds itself once more in open conflict, we must ensure that our comrades serving in the militias are disciplined and adequately follow the rules of civility. For we must ensure that the Kuomintang's NRA earns a reputation as a formidable fighting force and one capable of discipline and respect.

name: Wage Protracted War
description: Outnumbered and outgunned, for years the NRA that has resided in Fujian has learned that fights can be won by unconventional means. There are ways that a people can fight and we will encourage our forces to infiltrate and sabotage enemy lines, raising resistance and hope that the long promised national salvation will come.

name: Petition the Internationale for Aid
description: Since our party's founder Dr. Sun Yat-sen sought the Internationale for aid and recognition in organising the reorganisation of the Kuomintang in 1924, we have maintained cordial ties with our revolutionary comrades in the Internationale. Let us send a message out, that we will be in need of their help once more.

name: The Hundred Workshops Programme
description: As we lack the industrial bases of our neighbours and we lack the access to the other arms industries of China, our comrades have taken it upon themselves to create their own rifle patterns and arms. Until we manage to successfully establish a true revolutionary government, we must do all we can to arm our militias and soldiers.

name: Our Comrades Overseas
description: While most members of the Kuomintang fled for exile in China or in Europe, there were also those who followed Sun Fo and other centrists - into exile in Hawaii and Southeast Asia. Long disconnected from the KMT, with news of our revolution spreading - they have offered their vocal and financial support for our new uprising.

name: Rally the Mass Movement
description: As instructed by our late founder, the Kuomintang is to lead the oppressed classes of China to break their chains and to work together in order to resist the imperialists and their warlord lackeys. Let us rally the peasants in the countryside and the workers in the cities to join together and participate in our national revolution once more!

name: All for the Nation
description: As the situation looks increasingly grim on the front-lines, remember comrades of our valiant struggles such as the Battle at Mianhu, where the high-spirited yet outnumbered Whampoa students managed to defeat a much larger force led by Chen Jiongming. In those same ideals of self-sacrifice, honour, and bravery, let us inspire the NRA to carry on the same Whampoa spirit one last time.

name: Host the First Repatriated Congress
description: After nearly a decade in exile, the Chinese Kuomintang has surpassed all odds and has once more established a formidable presence in the chaotic political situation of China. With the success of the NRA in the League War, calls have been sent out throughout the Chinese country - to rally support for the Kuomintang's First Repatriated Congress as a reunited and revived political force.

name: Reinforce the Foreign Ministry
description: In order to achieve international recognition with not just the nations of the world but also of the Chinese expatriate diaspora, we will re-establish the former foreign ministry of the Party to propagate our ideals and our mission to the world. Furthermore, let us reach out to the oppressed peoples of Asia to look to our revolution as inspiration for carrying out their own national liberation.

name: Our Shanghai Connections
description: While seen as the high water mark of Western imperialism in China, Shanghai is home to thousands of workers and gangsters who are sympathetic to our pursuit of the national revolution - it was also the city in which many in the Party fled to after the failure of the Northern Expedition. With our position on the Chinese eastern seaboard secured, let us re-establish these connections in the Pearl of the East.

name: Reopen the Whampoa Military Academy
description: In 1924, in accordance with the ideals of Sun Yat-sen, the Whampoa Military Academy was created to house China's next generation of officers and generals to partake in the national revolution. With the return of the Kuomintang in China once more, the Central Committee has unanimously agreed to authorise the re-establishment of the military academy in preparation for national unification.

name: Legacy of the MinGan Insurgency
description: As the NRA shifts from unconventional warfare to conventional warfare, our high command has agreed to maintain the tactics and strategies mastered during the MinGan insurgency. This method of war focuses on rapid movements throughout rough terrain, fighting defensively when it is called for, waging a protracted war, and seeking out encirclements in order to annihilate larger enemy forces.

name: Embrace Encirclement Tactics
description: As we will often find ourselves outnumbered, let us seek to disrupt enemy communications through harassment, ambush, and sabotage with preliminary attacks before having our soldiers manoeuvre sneakily between enemy forces, and then dealing fatal blows at weak points in enemy lines. Once we have surrounded the enemy, we will continue to press our attacks to fully annihilate them until they have no escape.

name: Masters of the Land
description: Those who have served in the Jiangxi-Fujian Insurgency or had partaken in the earlier First Northern Expedition have accumulated years of practical military experience in the Chinese countryside. Each officer is thoroughly familiar with the people of his home town, the seasonal patterns of his home province, and the terrain of whom he had grown up with. With this mastery of the land comes invaluable experience.

name: Revolutionary Arms
description: In the hills of Fujian where the flames of revolution continued to burn, the National Revolutionary Army was forced to either hope that arms shipments from the Internationale would reach the Fujian government safely or instead turned to locally producing copies of existing Western or Chinese firearms. Let us continue that tradition by encouraging the workers of the land to produce arms for the revolutionary army.

name: Strike Quick, Strike Fast
description: In Western military theory,initiative is often a kinetic force directly based on offensive action but within the NRA, initiative is a potential force - it is a freedom of action, the ability of an army to go where its commander wishes it to go. The idea of retreat follows this concept naturally, by withdrawing tactically from engagement - we are able to retain movement in the face of a stronger attack.

name: The People's War
description: We wage a revolution not purely for the sake of the national revolution against imperialism but also a revolution for the oppressed peoples of China - long bound to their feudal chains. Let us encourage the people to rise up with us, as our soldiers march proudly through the liberated areas - we will encourage those who will want to eat and be free, to join us in our glorious cause.

name: Adopt Unconventional Means
description: While armies in China are used to fighting in conventional manners, our forces have long earned their expertise in the guerrilla zone by taking advantage of much larger enemy forces with harassment, ambush, and sabotage. The farther the enemy penetrates into our base area, the longer and more vulnerable his communications and supply lines become - the easier we are able to strike him where he can't see.

name: Army of the Revolution
description: The effectiveness of a modern military command structure does not depend only on the capabilities of its individual members, it also depends on their cohesion to the greater mission ahead. The officers and generals of the National Revolutionary Army are dedicated men to the Kuomintang and to the shared belief that they fight for their nation's salvation and freedom.

name: Look to the West
description: In the same way that the Kuomintang is bringing progress to the nation, the National Revolutionary Army must be a vanguard for Chinese military development. Many officers have studied extensively in modern European military academies across the last decade, and are ready to apply those lessons to build a new National Revolutionary Army with the latest in doctrine and technology.

name: Encourage Widespread Radio Use
description: A major innovation used during the Great War in Europe was the radio, which tremendously expanded military communication as well as enhanced command and control in the battlefield. The use of radios is still in its infancy in China, but with some effort we can quickly augment our forces with this new technology - critical for coordinated, concentrated strikes in vulnerable enemy positions.

name: Create the Supply Corps
description: \"An army marches on its stomach\"\nA fact that our Internationale advisors are quick to remind us of. If we are to sustain operations along a frontline as large as China, we cannot simply rely on ad-hoc supply chains or the generosity of the locals. Instead, a centralised, regularly monitored system of provisions must be created that will allow us to fight across long distances.

name: Mechanised Units
description: Some pragmatic compromises have to be made, even as we begin sweeping changes to our military structure. Du Yuming is a long-time WMARCA commander but has expressed willingness to lead in the creation of a mechanised force - proof that politics does not have to get in the way of professionalism. A mobile strike force for our revolutionary army will give us a key advantage over our warlord rivals.

name: Force Concentration
description: If we are to avoid stalemates and the grinding sort of conflict that we can ill afford, we must take inspiration from the lessons learned in the trenches of the last major war. After careful scouting and planning, weak points in enemy lines must be assailed in one great, focused attack using modern combined arms. The widening breach will allow for breakthroughs to win us the day.

name: Tighten Army Centralisation
description: In the insurgency period, command and control was an utter mess - left to the poorly coordinate initiative of various militia commanders. This might have worked in evading League patrols, where competent generals were often purged and the elite German trained units held in Nanjing to keep Sun Chuanfang in power, but a real staff officer system must be created if we are fight against determined foes.

name: Study European Air Tactics
description: A critical force multiplier that has been increasingly refined in Europe is the development of modern air arms. Initially used as a means of reconnaissance, its applications have multiplied across the last few decades - even warlords have been buying planes. André Malraux has gathered foreign volunteer pilots to serve us as we train Chinese ground crews, but one day we will claim the skies for our own.

name: The Modern NRA
description: The Modern NRA is one built along European lines, one that integrates artillery, armour, and aircraft with advanced communications and dedicated logistics. It is the vanguard of a new China, a revolutionary force that was meant to be since Whampoa first opened. It is the legacy of countless martyrs, whose blood will ensure that China will soon be able to stand toe to toe with European imperialists!

name: Encourage Political Commissars
description: \"What is the purpose of the National Revolution.\" To the unenlightened masses of the country, questions like this pervade their every thought - impeding their will and desire to fight. In accordance with the Party's duty and ideals, let us encourage divisions and battalions to raise units of commissars to remind our soldiers of their duty.

name: Renovate the Fujianese Naval Academies
description: Fujian is home to many sailors and across the Five Provinces many maritime institutions have been established over the years. The realities of the warlord era meant that naval development has seen the short end of the stick when it comes to military priorities: the League did the bare minimum to patrol their coasts. Now that we are masters of much of China's eastern seaboard, it is our duty to keep it safe.

name: Renovate the Jinling Arsenal
description: The Jinling Arsenal built by the Qing Dynasty in 1865 was one of China's first modern arsenals - designed to help design and produce ordinance and other more heavier weaponry. Left behind to waste by the Zhili warlords and abandoned during the chaotic fighting of the League War, let us seek to renovate the former arsenal and turn it into the armoury of the revolution.

name: Dare to Die Corps
description: The tradition of heroic martyrdom dates back to the years before the Xinhai Revolution, when revolutionary martyrs charged forward into battle without a care for their life but filled with devotion to their country. Now that we find ourselves in pursuit of the revolutionary mission, we must encourage those within our forces to be prepared to give the ultimate sacrifice necessary.

name: Inherit our Comrades' Arms
description: Years of exile and reliance on the Third Internationale has led us to become familiarised with the weaponry of our European socialist friends. Their arsenals contain many now outdated pieces such as the French 75 mm, that nonetheless can be repurposed for military use in China. Their weapons that once helped them win their own revolutions at home, will now serve to aid our revolution.

name: Restore the Political Department
description: The secret ingredient to the National Revolutionary Army's total dedication to the Kuomintang cause is their thorough political education conducted by party representatives in the Political Department. This created an ideological backbone in each Whampoa cadet that allowed the NRA to go toe-to-toe with much larger warlord armies - only German intervention could save them. It is high time we revive this department.

name: Deal with the Warlords
description: Warlordism is a blight on the Chinese nation, an oppressive institution that threatens not only national unity but prosperity. As we find our footing, having driven out the local warlords in the League, we must not forget the millions of others living under the boots of petty tyrants. It is too early to challenge our rivals for national leadership, but in the mean time we shall oust militarists as opportunities arise.

name: Eyes in the Dark
description: Real strategy requires cunning, and for all the bright coloured banners and flowery language that accompanies liberation, in the shadows lies plenty of opportunities for skulduggery. If we are to stay one step ahead of opponents, we need to coordinate our intelligence efforts, and that means creating a formal espionage apparatus. Fittingly, there will be plenty of intrigue involved in deciding on an agency.

name: Revive the Military Affairs Commission
description: An army without leadership is a mob, and as the National Revolutionary Army spreads its wings it needs now more than ever capable men at the helm. Modern military organisation means that no one person could ever lead a campaign alone: a council of staff, experts, and commanders are needed. The army however is haunted by ghosts of its past, as it resolves who ought to sit on the revived MAC.

name: Complete the Revolutionary Mission
description: Even as Dr. Sun approached the end of his life, he dreamed that the party would one day march north from its bases in Guangzhou to liberate the nation - toppling the failed Beiyang government. Although he knew it was unlikely he'd see the day (finally succumbing to cancer in Beijing during negotiations), with our forces gathered we will finally meet him there in that city. Once again, we march for the freedom of the nation, and for the Eternal Premier's sake we will not fail!

name: Provisional Legislative Yuan
description: The concept of the Legislative Yuan owes itself to the late Dr. Sun's Three Principles of the People that proposed a separation of power into five branches, with the Yuan being the law making organ when the Assembly is not in session. Since our position is still precarious however, let us seek to legitimise the Party's rule by establishing a provisional yuan for the revolutionary government.

name: Establish the National Bureaucracy
description: While our party's late founder Dr. Sun envisioned that there would be a necessary stage of the party-state and tutelage, we must undertake efforts to legitimise our control of the former League. Until the country is reunified, we will have to hold off on drafting a constitution. Nonetheless, an organic law shall be passed to govern in a constitution's stead, ushering in the return of a formal Executive Yuan.

name: Tender to the Masses
description: As part of the Kuomintang's commitment to the mass movement, the Party is to be the vanguard to represent the oppressed workers and peasants of China from the chains of their local bullies, the corrupt bourgeoisie gentry, and the imperialists. If we are to succeed in bringing the revolution to China, then we must teach the true people of China to rise up and realise their revolutionary potential.

name: Promote Revolutionary Culture
description: Since the Xinhai Revolution of 1911, new thinkers and ideas have emerged into the Chinese political and literary scene as those in our country have sought to find connections with Chinese values and Western ideals. In order to strengthen the revolutionary cause, we will inspire the creation of such a revolutionary culture - to support and direct the people's art to support the cause of our revolution.

name: The Liberation of the Chinese Woman
description: As our experiences in the MinGan Zone showed, the national revolution is not just the struggle of the Chinese people against the imperialists but it is also a social revolution; a revolution to uphold centuries of oppression and to bring forth a new era of equality. As such, we will encourage our country's women to take part in the revolution and to fight for a new world for themselves.

name: Formulate Land Distribution
description: While certainly a controversial and hotly debated issue between the multiple factions within the Kuomintang, the time has come to discuss the preliminary acts of a comprehensive land reform in order to strengthen the mass movement and to end feudal practices once and for all. As part of the revolutionary direction, we shall seek to address the long-standing issue of land reform in China.

name: Power to the United Front
description: As part of our promise to the Third Internationale in exchange for arms, supplies, and recognition from the socialist nations of the West; we are to undertake the Chinese National Revolution with the aid of the League of Chinese Syndicalists. Together, let us work together in a new united front to free our nation from imperialism once and for all.

name: Intensify Reconstruction Efforts
description: As one of China's most developed regions, the former League of Eight Provinces still lies ravaged by the recent liberation by the National Revolutionary Army. If we are to continue the revolution and earn the support of the masses, then we must seek to rapidly intensify our reconstruction efforts of eastern China in order to build a suitable base for the National Revolutionary Government.

name: Redistribute Warlord Assets
description: Too long have the masses in China been oppressed by the corrupt and brutal warlords that have divided our great country. With our recent victory over several of these warlords, we now have access to their assets and property, which we may see fit to return to the people or to utilise them for the sake and purposes of the national revolution.

name: Nationalise the Railways
description: Long has the Chinese worker been forced to toil, sweat, and bleed for the dark and steaming mines and railways of the imperialist colonisers who have exploited China's resources and wealth for their own. With the success of the National Revolution in Eastern China, we shall seek to take over all foreign railway industries and tracks in order to utilise their strength for the Chinese nation.

name: The Ministry of Communications
description: Propaganda can be disseminated in various ways from pamphlets and newspapers, but also through modern methods such as broadcasting and the radio. By direct order of the Central Committee, we will create the Ministry of Communications to accomplish this task of national broadcasting. Not only must we win the wars of unification but we must also win the hearts and minds of the people.

name: Develop the MinGan Region
description: The MinGan Insurgent Zone was for a while, the last bastion of the nationalist revolution in China. While we certainly applaud the efforts of Song Qingling's populist government in the region, with our access to greater resources - we now have the opportunity to further develop this important region and improve our support with the people of Jiangsu and Fujian.

name: Revive Eastern China
description: Weeks of battle and disorder has led to chaos and destruction along the eastern provinces of China in places such as Jiangsu and Anhui. While the Kuomintang has been at work in reorganising local governments and repairing infrastructure, let us intensify reconstruction efforts in these provinces in order to strengthen support and to build up our revolutionary base government.

name: Bulwark of the National Revolution
description: At last, we have returned. Nanjing - the city of the Ming emperors and the former presidential capital of our late beloved Dr. Sun Yat-sen, has finally been liberated by the National Revolutionary Army. It is here in Nanjing where the flame of revolution continues to burn unbothered, where the flag of the Blue Sky, White Sun, and Wholly Red Earth shall guide the great rays of the national revolution!

name: The Northern Expedition Avenged!
description: It has finally been done. The revolutionary mission passed down to us from Dr. Sun and Generalissimo Chiang Kai-shek has finally been achieved, this time without the intervention of [GER.GetNameDef]. With the national revolution secured in both Nanjing and Beijing, the time has come for the rest of China to finally come together under the leadership of the KMT. Zhonghua Minguo Wansui!

name: A New Day in Beiping
description: Following the reconquest of Beijing from the perfidious warlords and the so-called \"Emperor\" that ran our country into ruin, the imperial capital has now fallen into our hands. To inaugurate our new mastership over China, we shall rebuild the devastated city in our nationalist image. We start by restoring the city's name of Beiping to distance it from the old order, bestowing upon it a more modest name.

name: Host the Second Repatriated Congress
description: The Chinese Nationalist Party has succeeded where so many have failed and as such, it is appropriate once more to convene a grand congress of leftists, revolutionaries, patriots, and other like-minded individuals to draft and plan out the next phase of the Chinese Revolution. Topics of discussion will range from economic reform to dealing with the ever-present threat of [JAP.GetNameDef].

name: National Reconstruction Commission
description: The National Reconstruction Commission was the idea of the late Dr. Sun to help rebuild China's economy after years of foreign humiliation. We will seek to end the era of being a semi-feudal and semi-colonial state by embarking on a rapid and vast programme of modernisation, bringing China from the developing world to one that can hopefully rival the West.

name: Create the NEC
description: In order to better coordinate the National Reconstruction Commission, a committee known as the National Economic Council has been set up to manage the country's new autarkic policies as well as to promote the rapid industrialisation and extraction of our natural resources. Through carefully and bureaucratic centralised economic planning, we will be able to bring about the administrative and economic unification of our country.

name: Embrace Autarky
description: To many in the Kuomintang, the roots of China's woes lie in her unfortunate economic dependence on the imperialist world - which seeks to do nothing more than to take advantage of her natural resources and wealth. With the leadership of the Party, we will embrace the notion and idea of economic self-sufficiency, however we will also promote the growth of national capitalism in select coastal regions to help develop our economy.

name: Develop the Heavy Industry Sector
description: Despite the industrial port cities, industrialisation in China is still lacking compared to the rest of the world. While most of our initial industrial reforms were centred around the development of light and civilian industries, we will expand our industrial efforts by promoting the creation of larger industrial projects for both civilian and military use.

name: Entrenching Dangguo
description: Following the collapse of the NRA and the First Northern Expedition, few dared to dream that the flag of the White Sun, Blue Sky, and Wholly Red Earth would fly over Beijing. Despite the completion of the Second Northern Expedition, there are still those who threaten the success of the revolution. As we end the military phase of the revolution, we must work together in this next phase of political tutelage to safeguard our goals.

name: Secure Foreign Recognition
description: As few would dispute our legitimacy at this point with our capture of Beijing, it is imperative that we reach out to the Western nations especially our friends in the Third Internationale to receive recognition as the sole Republic of China. While we are still waging an offensive to win the hearts and minds of the Chinese people, we must also seek to establish our international reputation.

name: The Fate of Our Fellow Republicans
description: With the success of the Second Northern Expedition, the Kuomintang has emerged from a shattered revolutionary movement back into the situation of national contender-ship. As the Nationalist Party now holds both the Northern and Southern Capital, let us reach out to fellow non-Party aligned republicans and determine their stance of support towards the National Revolution.

name: Preparing for the Long War
description: It will not come easy. The enemy will push into our cities, ravage our coastline, and torment our long-divided nation. At times, we will be forced to fall back - perhaps even towards the interior of the country but we will never surrender our civilisation away. The war will be long but our determination to win shall last even longer - we will accept nothing less than absolute victory.

name: The Third Repatriated Congress
description: With the conclusion of the War of Resistance and the unification of Manchuria back into China, the Kuomintang is finally able to proclaim itself as the true Republic of China. As the Republican dream is fully revived once more, the Party plans to host its third national congress in recent years, but fractures within the Party may lead to dramatic consequences for the Chinese nation...

name: In Pursuit of the People's Welfare
description: Minsheng, is the belief in ensuring that the Chinese people have access to equal opportunities and livelihoods. The late founding father of the Party Dr. Sun believed that livelihood must be expanded into the areas of clothing, food, housing, and mobility. Under the Nationalist Government, we shall take steps to ensure our society draws closer to this principle.

name: Establish the National Health Administration
description: Inspired by advances in European healthcare, the National Health Administration (NHA) is an organisation established by the Party's Ministry of Health. Inspired by Dr. Sun's belief that a physically weak nation cannot survive in the competitive world, the NHA will accomplish this by creating vaccination and sanitation programmes, local health clinics, and rural mobile health centres.

name: Academia Sinica
description: The Academia Sinica was created after the Second Repatriated Congress of the Kuomintang following the passage of the Organic Law of the Academia Sinica - a project proposed by the World Society. The Academy is directly under the National Government and shall offer classes in a multitude of subjects from geology to new modern Western ideas such as psychology.

name: Institute of Revolutionary Practice
description: As our territory grows significantly larger in size from the former insurgency region of the MinGan Zone and then to the National Revolutionary Government; we must remind comrades of the true revolutionary nature of their mission. Furthermore, we must help the people realise their revolutionary consciousness - to turn them into a revolutionary vanguard.

name: The Disbandment Conference
description: Organised by the main military leaders of the National Revolutionary Army, a National Disbandment Commission is established to deal with the NRA's bloated size and problems after the Second Northern Expedition. The posts of commander in chief, field commanders, and other wartime tactical roles are to be abolished and efforts were initiated to disband all superfluous troops.

name: Fate of the Beiyang Army
description: While the Beiyang and other warlord regimes were merely institutions of corruption and outlets for foreign imperialism to exploit the Chinese people, there are certainly those officers and generals  who are progressive enough that they are willing to offer their services to the National Revolutionary Army. As a way to deal with reconstruction faster, let us provide them with commissions so that they may now serve the Party.

name: Repossess National Arsenals
description: As our forces have liberated China with the fervour of unification, we have seized multiple abandoned arms factories and arsenals left behind by their provincial warlords - many of whom have built up arms-production facilities of their own over the years. Let us utilise these arsenals and upgrade them so that they may serve the needs of the Party and nation rather than another power-hungry regional tyrant.

name: Standardise Army Organisation
description: The National Revolutionary Army by order of the National DIsbandment Commission is hereby authorised to adopt two forms of division-types to standardise military organisation. With the conclusion of both the guerrilla phase of revolution and the Second Northern Expedition, the NRA is now to transition from the People's Army to one that is capable of bringing the national revolution to Asia.

name: Chart the Military Regions
description: The struggle to unify the country both militarily and politically lies much as a result due to the sheer vast expanse of the Chinese nation. Under the Military Affairs Commission, the National Revolutionary Army is to divide its forces and regions of operation into twelve distinctive military regions (with overlap between provinces) to aid with military organisation.

name: Chinese Industrial Cooperatives
description: The \"gonghe\" programme (Work Together) seeks to organise grass-roots military and civilian industrial development with the creation of self-supporting cooperatives, mainly in the rural areas to create employment for workers and refugees. Not only will this programme benefit us economically but it will also provide the workers a chance to organise and utilise their democratic rights.

name: Authorise \"Special Services\"
description: Revolutions are often a dance between dreams and nightmares. Beneath all the high-minded convictions the party holds, there is often a need for \"special services\" to \"handle\" challenges that crop up over the course of China's transformation. Grim though it may be, we must do what is necessary to win - even if it means holding our nose and closing our eyes. Some battles must be fought in the dark.

name: Found the Central Aviation School
description: Fitting of China's war-torn, divided nature during the Warlord Era, many different warlord factions as well as the Zhili government sought to create their own air force to get an advantage over one another. These programmes were often too small and underfunded to be much good on their own, but if we were to bring them all together under one roof it could be the foundation of a real force multiplier for our armies.

name: Encourage the Doctrine of Initiative
description: The concept of initiative as a means of offence is one that is employed by the National Revolutionary Army but a concept that we will certainly apply to our own aerial programme. By encouraging our pilots to follow the European concepts of aerial initiative, we will have our fighters and bombers focus on more offensive capabilities rather than defensive ones.

name: Purchase Foreign Blueprints
description: While China certainly has the resources and capabilities to launch its own aerial development scheme, our technological progress in flight still lags years behind modern European designs. Years of exile in Europe have allowed us to test and examine European plane designs from the British Republican Air Force and the Communard Air Force. Let us purchase foreign blueprints and designs to create our own modern planes.

name: Flying Tigers
description: While our planes may certainly be inspired by European designs and help from the air came in the form of European volunteers, our efforts to create a native and solely Chinese air force is growing steadily, and with it, more and more pilots are claiming successes in the air day by day. Furthermore, we will also allow our revolutionary sisters to join us in the air to grow our air force.

name: The XP-0 Project
description: Based on the French fighter, the Loire L46, the XP-0 developed by the officer Chu Chia-Jen is China's first attempts at a native fighter prototype. Armed with 4x20 mm Hispano-Suiza underwing cannons and capable of carrying bombs as well - our goal for the XP-0 is to reduce our dependency on foreign purchased aircraft and instead foster pride and prestige with our own native aviation industry.

name: Create the 9th Column
description: In a joint effort with the ROCAF and the NRA, an experimental division has been created of the most excellent and fit of our soldiers to serve in an elite unit. This brave unit is inspired by contemporary usage of paratroopers, allowing units to deploy into combat zones without land passage. While such tactics are radical and new with casualties to be expected, fortune favours the bold!

name: Encourage Attack Aviation
description: As shown in modern conflicts around the world especially by the world's major powers, the future in aviation lies in combined efforts with ground troops to launch decisive breakthroughs with an unprecedented level of firepower. Our flying students in Europe have witnessed attack bombers being used in European conflicts and are eager to share their knowledge with us.

name: Patrol the Coasts
description: While China's vast expanses connect us with the rest of Europe, her most industrial regions and sources of trade lie with the bountiful Chinese coastline. In times of war, an enemy with a stronger naval presence will certainly make an attempt to seize or blockade our vital sea lanes. In order to fight back, we will encourage the use of naval bombers to patrol and sink all who try!

name: Master Air-Land Integration
description: The combination of aerial power and mechanised warfare combines the firepower of tactical and close air-support bombers with mobile troops. While the wars of the Warlord Era were fought with rifles and artillery, the future of modern warfare lies in an army's use of mobile artillery units in the form of direct air support to launch devastating offensives into the heart of the enemy.

name: Liberation from the Skies
description: Off into the clouds we fly up with our determination to defend our motherland, from the Kunlun Mountains to the shores of the Pacific Ocean. We fly over ranges, rivers, and majestic mountains determined to liberate the Chinese proletariat from the skies. Courageous and diligent, we strive to secure the prosperity of our civilisation forever with our air force!

name: March of the Red Army
description: For the first time in Chinese history, a nationalist and revolutionary army determined to liberate the Chinese people has succeeded in bringing about the unification of the Chinese country. Heroically we fight as we march to the sun of world revolution, we will continue on under the banner of Dr. Sun Yat-sen with our comrades side by side in bringing about the total liberation of all oppressed peoples.

name: Expand Mechanised Operations
description: European developments made by syndicalist officers such as Basil Liddel-Hart over the past few years have illustrated the importance of mechanised warfare in future battles and wars as a means of speed and breakthrough. Given the NRA's own favouritism of mobility and speed, some of our officer corps have proposed that we gradually adopt more experimental mechanised operations.

name: Examine Foreign Designs
description: It is no secret that while China certainly has the means and potential to fully embrace elements of a modern military such as mechanisation, the time to do so will certainly take a long while. We have long sought training and advice from the European syndicalist nations whom are leading the world in armoured warfare and we should do well to look to their designs for inspiration.

name: Domestic Armour Production
description: While we may recognise the superiority of European designs and concepts, European methods of armoured warfare or unsuitable for the terrain and battles fought in China and across Asia. It will do us well to adopt and improvise by tapping into China's resources and formulating our own means of domestic armour production that may one day rival even the quality of Europe.

name: Forward Thinking Officer Corps
description: The future of any successful military lies not in its generals or its soldiers but rather the concepts and theories that drive progress within our own doctrine. With the return of the Kuomintang and the NRA's success in the Northern Expedition, some officers who stayed overseas in training have now returned with fresh, bold, and radical ideas on how to modernise the NRA.

name: The Modern Chinese Soldier
description: The warlords' armies were infamous worldwide for their apparent incompetence and lack of modern equipment. As part of our late Dr. Sun Yat-sen's plans to create a modern army, we take pride in our efforts to modernise the image of the Chinese soldier. Equipped with the latest rifles and imbued with the spirit of revolution, the rifleman of the NRA stands above all else!

name: Broad Front Operations Capacity
description: With the National Revolutionary Army reformed and larger than ever before, we are now able to adopt greater operational capacity on broader fronts. With improved reconnaissance units as well as a greater understanding of logistics and air power, the NRA will be able to undertake  greater and larger campaigns than it was previously capable of.

name: Reinforce the Rearguard!
description: While our elite troops are distracted on the front lines, we should also take steps to ensure that the rear areas are secured. Despite the victory of the NRA in the Second Northern Expedition, there are plenty of regions within the country that are yet to be completely pacified. In order to maintain order and legitimacy, we will provide a greater deal of support to our rear guard forces.

name: The Soul of Whampoa
description: The Whampoa Military Academy is more than a mere military school, its mythos stems from the revolutionary spirit that floods its dorms and rooms. Whampoa is the bulwark of the national revolution, a source of strength for all Chinese to look up to. Despite hundreds of alumni becoming martyrs in the revolution, the future is bright for the next generation of Whampoa, the very soul of the national revolution.

name: The War of Resistance
description: Now our country faces perhaps its greatest danger in the history of Chinese civilisation and we may face the complete annihilation of our race and culture if we do not act fast. Let us create a rallying call throughout the country for all of our Minzu to build a new Great Wall of flesh and blood to defend China from what may befall her, arise all ye who refuse to be slaves once more! March on!

name: Prepare Stay Behind Cells
description: Behind every blade of grass, lies a Chinese peasant who is willing to carry his dadao and his rifle to wage war on the enemy. Even if we are forced to withdraw in the face of an overwhelming enemy, our partisans and bandits will wreck havoc behind enemy lines through sabotages and skirmishes. For every inch of soil we lose to the enemy, we will bite back.

name: Fortify the Coastal Bulwark
description: China's vast land expanse means that the enemy will most likely attempt a naval invasion of our country rather than a direct land invasion. Given the economic and political importance of the coastal regions, we should do well to prepare in advance of the enemy's invasion by fortifying and preparing the coastline with bunkers, pillboxes, and other defences.

name: Harness the Peoples' Will
description: It is the duty of every Chinese to stand up in the face of adversity, especially when the very existence of our people is threatened by imperialism. Too long have the Chinese proletariat been trampled by the boots of warlordism and imperialism, it is time for the Han race to remember their glorious heritage as the sons of Yan and Huang and rise up together in patriotic unity to defend our Minzu!

name: Restore the Ministry of Navy
description: The Navy has ailed over the last few decades, forced to play a subservient role: a secondary priority compared to the army, an auxiliary force for foreign concessionists, and a money pit for our treasury. No more. If China is to be truly free, it must have a navy capable of defending its shores and protecting its trade. The first step is to create an independent command capable of overseeing its revival.

name: Scavenge the Beiyang Fleet
description: Given we only have so many resources on hand, our limited production capacity, and the long construction time for new ships, it is best that make use of what our Beiyang predecessors have left us. Although much of it has been either stolen or is a smouldering wreck, there are still ships, facilities, and personnel that can reused for a much better purpose. Nothing is irreplaceable, but every bit helps.

name: Prepare the Coastal Garrison Plan
description: China's long coastline is a major vulnerability in the event of foreign invasion, as prior wars have demonstrated. Although the land-based defences are in the army's domain, the fleet also has a responsibility to keep invaders off our shores and harry those foolish enough to try. With adequate early-warning systems and crafty tactics, we can strike our foes at their weakest by the coast.

name: Death from the Depths
description: Beneath the surface in the darkest depths, intrepid men in deadly vessels lurk. Submarine warfare was in its infancy in the previous war, but has since become an equaliser between the haughty fleets of the status quo and the states that they oppress. We shall make full use of these technologies to raid enemy supply convoys supplying their invasion forces, and also pick off any vulnerable capital ships.

name: Coastal Defence Stratagems
description: It is not enough to simply know where our foes will be arriving. We must develop an arm of light ships capable of disrupting enemy attacks - using speed, ingenuity and above all daring to strike. These coastal defence ships must be cheap and designed for China's coast, laying various traps and coordinating with the ground to gain an advantage over our foes more expensive vessels. Likewise, they must be able to protect our own shipping.

name: Blockade Runners
description: It is unfortunately a reality we face, that for all of our efforts we will only at best be able to protect areas in the immediate vicinity of our coastline. Outside of our fortified harbours and far away from even our strike-planes, it is likely our foes will attempt to cut off major shipments using their naval superiority. We must develop strategies and crafts capable of evading enemy patrols and breaking the blockade.

name: Consolidate Maritime Peace
description: If we are to bring prosperity back to our nation, we must work to calm the seas and bring back harmony to the waters. This means creating a force capable of protecting our trade from foreign thieves, defending the nation's commerce in our waters. We shall reinforce our Navy and Coast Guard's defensive capabilities, making them adept at shielding our precious cargo in the event of war.

name: Renovate the Jiangnan Dockyards
description: One of the most important naval facilities in the nation are the Jiangnan Dockyards. Forced to turn to civilian naval development to sustain its finances, now that we have successfully recovered Shanghai from foreign colonisers we will turn Jiangnan into the engine of a new, grander fleet of the Republic. An influx of investment will recruit new staff, create new dry-docks, and above all produce new ships.

name: New Navy, New Traditions
description: Tradition is important in life, but there are few places where it is of such significance as aboard the fleet. Even as China's naval capacity shrank, the fleet remains divided into various competing regional cliques. With a steady hand, we shall fuse them into one Chinese fleet, infused with the enlightenment of the Three Principles and combining the lessons learned across the nation. This is how we shall win.

name: Commission the Six Year Programme
description: The dreams of the revolutionaries often outstrip the government's actual ability to realise them. Nonetheless, when the party stated its goal of developing a capacity of 600,000 tons in 6 years, the Navy has gone full steam ahead with its plans. Working tirelessly day and night, hundreds of ships are planned, though admittedly few are above 500 tons. We at witnessing the birth of a new Chinese fleet.

name: Fleet of the Republic
description: The new republic needs a new fleet capable of defending its shores. With investments already underway and lost years slowly recovered, the once withered and divided Chinese fleet has been reborn. Already a new fleet is taking shape, capable of taking on foes it once had no choice but to cower from. We are a long way from becoming a great maritime power again, but our star continues to rise!

name: Integrate Naval-Air Coordination
description: Naval Aviation is a field that has made great strides over the last few decades. While it might be premature to believe us capable of such operations given our limited air and sea capabilities, we have an advantage over our more established peers in our lack of entrenched doctrines. Therefore, we must be willing to have flexibility, bringing both our naval and air assets together in a deadly combination.

name: \"Semper Fidelis\"
description: The Marine Corps of the Republic of China are about as old as the Republic itself. Built from the ashes of the old Navy Sentry Corps in 1914, various commanders including Sa Zhenbing hoped to create a force trained in amphibious landings after seeing the potency of the invading Eight-power alliance. The Fujian fleet has also sponsored large detachments of naval infantry. Together, they shall be the basis of a force capable of projecting abroad.

name: Invite Foreign Naval Advisors
description: We are not alone in this world, and we do not need to reinvent the wheel. Therefore, with the help of our allies in Europe and various independent experts we have hired from foreign fleets, we can enhance our own naval capabilities in a timely manner. Using designs purchased or \"borrowed\" from overseas, we will get our start in building a modern fleet worthy of our great nation.

name: Embrace the Surface Fleet Doctrine
description: New technologies in the air and beneath the sea are fascinating, but in the end of the day control of the water is determined by the surface fleet. And China has been without a competent one for far too long. We shall build a new armada capable of dominating the waves, bringing to heel those of the Japanese, Germans, and any others who dare to menace Asia.

name: Chinese Grand Fleet
description: It is not enough for us to be satisfied with petty gunboats and outdated cruisers. A real fleet requires capital ships, those capable of shredding apart enemy escorts and bombarding enemy fortifications. If we are serious about our naval ambitions, we must be willing to invest in the pricey grand vessels worth of great powers. We are living in the dawn of a new age in the Pacific, and may we be at the centre.

name: Look towards the Three Seas
description: China's destiny belongs not merely on the land but also across the three seas that surround it. Moreover, there are so many other peoples across Asia that yearn for liberation from colonial powers, and it is only by developing a fleet capable of challenging these oppressors that China can resume its leadership role for the continent. Our armies march, and our fleet will support them all the way.

name: Lead the Liberation of Asia
description: It is merely a natural progression that the Chinese Nationalist Revolution will come to encompass a greater revolution for the oppressed and downtrodden peoples of Asia against the scrounge that it is imperialism. We have displayed to the world over the past few years, that our methods bring freedom and liberation - that the Three Principles will free all those who listen to its words.

name: Coordinate the Afro-Asian Conference
description: The people of Africa and Asia have long been oppressed by the despicable West. China's successful revolution from imperialism is inspiring to them and China's resources can only be used to help them grow and rebuild from the trauma of colonialism. We will summon a conference of the free nations of the developing world, to jointly discuss the future of the developing world.

name: Aid the Developing World
description: China's renewed economic strength and her bountiful natural resources should be used to aid and serve our revolutionary comrades around the developing world. These people have long suffered and starved under the boot of imperialism, and China must take the leadership of helping them develop, rebuild, and heal from the centuries of humiliation brought down upon them.

name: Joint Pan-Asian Military Cooperation
description: The long-time veteran officers and generals of the National Revolutionary Army are perhaps the best in all of Asia due to their long-time experiences fighting the revolution. Let us organise joint military training programmes and send our military, naval, and air advisors to our fellow Asian comrades so that they may modernise and strengthen their armed forces.

name: Five Principles of Peaceful Coexistence
description: Many of our Kuomintang comrades do acknowledge the Indian peoples' own fight of liberation against the imperialist nation of Britain. It is better to work together than to fight and weaken ourselves to the imperialists. We will meet with the Indian Government to resolve the issue of Aksai Chin and Tawang and fight together as two young revolutionary nations.

name: The Chinese Expeditionary Force
description: We have spent much time with our dear European comrades and will never forget their generosity when they allowed the Central Committee to reside in exile in their free syndicalist nations. Now in their hour of need, it is truly fitting that we dispatch men and resources to aid our dear socialist brothers and sisters.

name: Reach out to the Overseas Communities
description: Even within the Central Committee, some members such as Chen Bijun come from expatriate communities within the greater Chinese diaspora. Let utilise the networks and connections of the former Overseas Chinese Commission in order to extend the influence of groups such as the RCA within the greater international Chinese community - to raise further support for our current regime.

name: Encourage Foreign Investments
description: China is a large and vast country with a trove of national resources and materials that are necessary in the modern world. In order to generate capital and help grow our economy, let us encourage foreign companies to bring their business to China and invest here, so that we may develop our national economy as well as helping forge relationships with nations around the world. Together, we can achieve so much more if we are driven by the notion of peaceful cooperation.

name: Extend the MMIC's Stay in China
description: The Internationale Military Mission in China has been pivotal to the success of the Chinese National Revolution over the last several years. Despite the success of unification and victory in the War of Resistance, their aid will certainly still be appreciated in helping aid the development of our armed forces. Let us seek to extend their stay - in order to continue the modernisation of our army.

name: The Dongfeng Project
description: For centuries, China has lagged significantly behind the rest of the world in terms of technological developments and only the most ambitious scientists and engineers in China could dream of an adequate ballistic missile programme. Inspired by the Internationale's Damocles Project, we will seek to replicate and reproduce their success with our own \"Dongfeng\"(East Wind) Project so that our national defence will be prepared for the future.

name: Revolutionary Diplomacy
description: Only China and the Chinese people are fit to carry out the revolution in East Asia. China's peculiar situation and her status as a cultural and political beacon in the region along with her own successful revolution are reasons why China should embark on a new diplomatic course. This direction is one of revolutionary diplomacy that would aim to seek us to work with fellow Asian peoples and to work towards greater socialist Pan-Asianism.

name: Establish Peoples' Livelihood Countries
description: China is the most important market in the East which is why her resources were so coveted during the age of imperialism. With newly gained national independence, it is China's duty to help other colonial nations striving for economic freedom to establish \"Peoples' Livelihood\" countries so that they would not develop into either syndicalist nations and capitalist nations but rather work with China in establishing minsheng in their own countries.

name: The Inevitable Demise of Capitalism
description: There is no greater evil state than the German Empire. Long has the German state oppressed the peoples of Eastern Europe, look as they yearn for freedom and independence from the despicable institution of Mitteleuropa. We have not forgotten Germany's involvement in the Northern Expedition and their enforcement of capitalistic warlordism in our country. Now, with China's strength reborn and our power unquestionable, it is time to destroy the root of all capitalism itself.

name: Uniting Anti-Colonial Minds
description: There are so many people across the Asian continent and the Pacific that cry out for freedom, their dreams beaten down by the oppression of Imperialism and its thugs. Their writings censored and their thoughts imprisoned, they languish away in exile or in dusty classrooms. If we were to bring them all together under liberation's guiding light, these bright minds can illuminate a new future for all peoples no longer beholden to the chains of dying empires.

name: Never Another Humiliation
description: This is a world of survival. Great powers seek only the ability for them to flex their muscles and to extend their Minzu across the globe, as such China must emulate this model if she is to survive. For we have seen what the foreign imperialists have done to their country and we know, that their greed will bring us to our country again - to divide and separate our great nation and humiliate our race. Let us increase funding for our military and navy to back our threats with strength.

name: Fanatical Militarism
description: The individual is merely a cog in the greater wheel of the national struggle. The Chinese man and woman must aspire to become a new individual, that is the new individual who subordinates his personal will and welfare to the dedication of the military. Death in battle shall seen as heroic martyrdom and we shall encourage all citizens of our country to prepare to offer their lives for the nation's national defence.

name: Repudiate the Catastrophe of 1927
description: Every Chinese person shall remember the date 1927 as the year the German imperialists sailed forth and destroyed the National Revolution, installing the imperialist Hanjian Puyi on the throne once more and sinking our nation into further warlordism. Now with China's strength returned and her power uncontested - it is truly time for us to repudiate the catastrophe of 1927. Finally, Germany shall know what it is like to lose everything.

name: Entrenching Isolation
description: We've experienced nothing but humiliation from our interactions with the foreigners over the years and it is clear that we will continue to gain nothing from our interactions with them. China's role since the era of the Great Ming was to maintain peace, prosperity, and security throughout Asia and it is only rightful that we return to our position as the bulwark and beacon of cultural supremacy in the region. As such, let us seek to focus on what should truly be just Chinese affairs.

name: Demand the Return of the Concessions
description: How we lamented the humiliation at selling out our fellow Chinese to the imperialists. We do not forget our Shanghai brothers and sisters, who have for years led the spirit of revolution against the reactionary powers. We however lead a New China, a China that can finally stand up to the humiliating system that is the Legation Mandate. We will liberate our countrymen, whether by peace or force.

name: We will Liberate Taiwan!
description: Our country faced no greater tragedy than selling out our fellow Chinese to the Japanese imperialists when we surrendered the island of Taiwan. Now that China is strong once more, it is our national duty as a Chinese people to unite with our Taiwanese countrymen. Our Taiwanese brothers and sisters yearn for the liberation and we will free them from their chains, uniting our country once more.

name: Consolidate the Frontiers
description: It is a priority to establish the fact that the frontier regions of Tibet, Mongolia, and Xinjiang are inherently part of the great Chinese nation. Too long have our fellow Chinese Minzu, lie oppressed by the imperialists but longing for our guidance to the National Revolution. As the late Dr. Sun taught us, when we unite and guide them, our country and civilisation will be great once more.

name: Beyond the MacMahon Line
description: The MacMahon Line was drawn unfairly by the British forcefully ceding the region of Tawang to the breakaway state of Tibet. It is a national outrage that this decision was made without our approval, a humiliation to our ability to intervene in our own national affairs as Tibet's affairs are China's affairs. With our nation strong once more, we will push forward and restore honour to China's territorial integrity.

name: Secure the Northern Frontier
description: Russia's proximity and reactionary regime has always reminded us that the threat of imperialism does not just come from the West but also to the North. Russia's greediness also eyes our claims to Mongolia and let us not forget that Outer Manchuria was once part of the greater Chinese state. If we are to safeguard our borders, it is imperative that we strike with surprise and force against the Russian Bear.

name: Strike German East Asia
description: The reactionary and capitalist nation that is [GER.GetNameDef] have sought nothing more but to exploit the Chinese people and nation. It was after all, at the height of the Northern Expedition, that the German thrust behind our rear - led to the collapse of our nation's salvation. As long as their imperialist regime exists in Asia, the Asian people cannot be free. It is our duty to save them.

name: Two Suns in the Sky
description: There is perhaps no greater imperialist and barbaric nation than Japan. Our people have suffered short than outright injustice at the hands of the Japanese who have always tried to take advantage of China's civilisation. Many of our countrymen still remember the devastation they caused in the War of Resistance. Now with our nation revived, it is time to prevent them from taking advantage of us again.

name: Liberate Southeast Asia
description: The Nanhai has long been China's sphere of cultural, social, economic, and political influence since the days of the Great Ming. There have long been fellow imperialists and comrades in Southeast Asia as well as our own expatriate countrymen who have yearned and supported our cause for liberation. Now we finally are in a position to repay them and use China's strength to unite us in solidarity.

name: Secure the Southern Seas
description: The South China Sea and beyond have long been under Chinese maritime control and it was under Chinese influence that these regions became thriving prosperous nations. As long as the reactionary state of [AST.GetNameDef] exists, then there can be no peace and the resources of these seas cannot be shared with China and her allies. We must take the initiative and secure the seas ourselves.

name: Ensure Security of the Pacific
description: Some in our government come from Hawaii themselves, as the Kuomintang boasts a remarkable presence within the island's Chinese community. They too have witnessed the barbarity of imperialism first hand as Hawaii was forcefully annexed by the United States of America. China must ensure that the Pacific is free from the imperialist machinations of the Americans, Japanese and all others who seek to control it, and become the guardian of the great sea.

name: Imperialism Crushed Forevermore
description: It has finally been done. With our country's natural glorious strength, we have successfully driven off every last holdout of foreign imperialism in Asia and the Pacific. The Asian peoples can now finally live in harmony and unity, with peace and cooperation - without the intervention of the West or the Japanese. No longer shall foreign imperialism threaten the Chinese people again.

name: Action Now!
description: The moment came and Song Qingling took it - the Kuomintang's budding dictator Wang Jingwei was ousted from power and a new government has been formed to guide China forward. Her Provisional Action Committee has truly lived up to its name, taking charge in China's darkest hour. However, they did not do it alone, and they might find that taking power is one thing but governing is another...

name: Rally the Peoples' Militias!
description: The PAC trained militia in the MinGan Insurgent Zone have long been the core of the national revolution and now when the revolution needs it the most, we must call them to action. Let us rally militia forces across the country to help secure the revolution from the counter-revolutionaries who will seek to destroy all we have fought for. Rise up comrades, the time is now!

name: Promises of Democracy
description: It is the duty of the Provisional Action Committee to inspire direct action by implementing local forms of self government led by PAC leaders to ensure that they remain safe from the allure of radicalism and to liberate them from years of instability and government corruption. The Provisional Action Committee of the Kuomintang seeks to use the party as an organ for the eventual democratisation of Chinese society.

name: Utilise Military Connections
description: The Guanxi Policy is the system of loyalty and revolutionary unity between the close associates and the hero of the revolution Deng Yanda. Through an elaborate network of interpersonal relationships amongst the leaders, PAC members are expected to follow these exemplary men and women led by General Deng Yanda to save the revolution. In times of crisis, certain individuals are gifted with the skills necessary for revolution.

name: Initiate Land to the Tiller
description: The Provisional Action Committee adheres to the model of land reform given to us by the late Dr. Sun. While all lands of the evil gentry, warlords, and foreign imperialists shall be returned to the people, we shall pursue the nationalisation of land while also granting the rights and ownership of land for those who work the land. Furthermore, land rents are to be hereby established and village associations formed to protect peasant interests.

name: Reconcile the RCA
description: Members of Wang's former Reorganised Comrades Associates hold less radical and authoritarian views as do the radical members of his clique. Led by Gu Mengyu, the RCA's Moderate wing opposes ideas of class conflict and shares our ideals on the land reform. With our leadership of the Party solidified, let us seek to reconcile them back into the Party as formal party members with their rights restored.

name: Fate of the CRS
description: The China Revival Society's hold on our army's radical ranks as well as their totalitarian and reactionary ideals cannot be tolerated by the Party. Nonetheless, some of them were our comrades in Whampoa and perhaps there is use of them yet. There is always the question of figures such as Dai Chunfeng, who seem amicable to cooperation. Perhaps they may offer us rewards and secrets for amnesty.

name: Initiate the Consultative Conference
description: Following the victory of the Unity Government in saving the revolution from the hands of former Chairman Wang Jingwei, it is only fitting that we invite delegates from the various political Republican and liberal factions who are interested in working with the Kuomintang in ensuring the growth of democracy in China. A conference is to be initiated to discuss the plans and designs for the revived Party and the future national constitution.

name: Guarantee Constitutional Freedoms
description: The late Dr. Sun Yat-sen in his writings on the notion of Minquan or the people's governance believed that all people are entitled to four basic democratic rights: the rights to election, the rights to initiative, the rights to referendum, and the rights to recall. Under the Judicial and Legislative Yuan, we will pass judgement and approve basic laws to guarantee the rights of the people so that democracy may finally grow in China.

name: Honouring Revolutionary Martyrs
description: We will never forget the martyrs of our nation and Party who helped pave the road for our revolution to succeed. Great leaders and patriots such as Liao Zhongkai, Hu Hanmin, and Chiang Kai-shek shall forever be remembered as heroes in the revolutionary cause to free our country. Furthermore, we must also bring back the body of Dr. Sun from [GetVictoryPointName_9843] to a rightful resting place in Nanjing.

name: Legalise Democratic Parties
description: During the necessary phase of political tutelage, it was important that the Kuomintang remain the sole organ of political and revolutionary activity due to the chaos and weakness of having a loose political structure, especially given the military nature of the National Revolution. With the country finally and fully united, there is no longer any need for the Kuomintang to be the sole party of the revolution.

name: Court Liberal Intellectuals
description: Liberals such as Hu Shih have long criticised the Chinese Nationalist Party for our so-called betrayal of constitutionalism and for the Party's adoption of party-state rule in order to train the masses. As we soften the stance on the party state and tutelage, let us reach out to these liberals and fellow intellectuals to remove the barriers of ideological thought and to pursue a genuine unified road towards liberalism.

name: Promote Nationalist Youth Organisations
description: It is important that the youth of our nation learn to love our nation's ten thousand years of cultural supremacy as well as for them to remember the martyrs and heroes of the National Revolution. By consolidating and forming boys and girls scouting and political organisations, we will encourage membership in this youth organisations to promote the values of the Three Principles of the People to China's next generation.

name: Rein in the Military
description: For a long time, Chinese politics and especially the politics of the Kuomintang have been dominated by the military due to the complex and unstable nature of the Chinese political scene. With national unification achieved and domestic counter-revolutionaries subdued, there is no longer any need for the military to play a large role in politics. It is time to curb the excess of military leadership by placing limits on those who can partake in the civilian government.

name: Promote Local Self-Government
description: It is the goal of the Party that the eventual education and training of the masses will allow local regions to establish successfully functioning local governments. Although the government shall still be Central in nature, we will encourage the growth of democratic principles at a grass-roots level, allowing regional leaders to execute decisions and ideas without the intervention of the Central Government.

name: The Third Stage of Revolution
description: Dr. Sun Yat-sen designed the revolution to occur in three great stages: the first being the military phase of the revolution in which martial law is needed, the second stage of transitional democracy in which the Party is to help encourage the exercise of political rights for the people. We are now in the third stage of this revolution, in which reconstruction can be completed and the need for political tutelage no longer is a requirement for governance.

name: The Vision of the Eternal Premier
description: The late Dr. Sun believed that democracy was the end goal of the National Revolution, but that democracy and nationalism must grow together under the leadership of a Party that aims to train and grow a revolutionary peoples into a revolutionary nation. At last, we have reached the stage of revolution where we are finally able to achieve this democracy - as such we have successfully completed and honoured the Late Premier's Will and Testament.

name: Convene the Peoples' Congress
description: The Party has to lead and convene a new Congress, one for the common people of China. The peasants and workers are to form the core of our new government, a broad united front of workers, peasants, women, soldiers, and other professional organisations that can elect representatives to a hierarchy of assemblies who shall exercise true power. At last, the true people of China have stood up, and it is only fitting that a new Congress represents their interests.

name: Workplace Democracy
description: In the future socialist society that is to come, the distinctions between intellectuals, workers, peasants, and merchants will cease to exist as everyone will labour for society. In order to meet the needs of production, these labourers will organise themselves into a variety of groups, win which all men and women will have equal say in the affairs of their organisations and their production.

name: Revolution for All Peoples
description: Unlike the radicals who declare that only class revolution is necessary for national liberation, Dr. Sun Yat-sen believed in revolution for the common people including the intellectuals, workers, peasants, and merchant classes. This is clearly stated in the declaration of the Kuomintang's First Congress, the the national revolution be a revolution for all peoples - working together to achieve the great unity together.

name: Minsheng Geming
description: According to Li Shizeng, progress manifests in history through a four political stages: the monarchical revolution, the revolution for people's sovereignty, the class revolution, and finally the revolution for world unity, the revolution for the people's livelihood, for social revolution, and for great unity. This particular social revolution shall be one based on the great ideals of Proudhon and Dr. Sun Yat-sen's teachings.

name: National Labour University
description: The National Labour University is the brainchild of the anarchist Cai Yuanpei and is inspired by the University of Labourers in Charleroi, Belgium. Its primary goal is to combine labour and learning to create a new kind of individual, the intellectual labourer. Considered by the Anarchists within the Party as the first step in the revolutionisation of Chinese education, the goal is to eradicate distinctions between classes and to train the next generation of labour leaders.

name: Collaboration of the Oppressed Classes
description: Unlike the radicals in the RCA or the Chinese Syndicalist Party that believe that class war is inevitable, we acknowledge that class merely an expression of selfish interests and an obstacle to the realisation of a humane society. Those who advocate for class struggle seek only the interests of a single class while the task of revolution given to us is to put such thoughts behind in the past forevermore  and towards the notion of an anarchist and free society.

name: Strengthen the Unions
description: While we seek the eventual eradication of social classes in Chinese society in the form of revolutionary groups, these groups cannot be established overnight. Hence when the revolution comes about, there will be chaos without organisation. As such it is imperative that we look to working with existing syndicates and unions and have the workers of the country unite and become the forefront of the social revolution that is to come.

name: The Two Stage Revolution
description: Many of us share the belief that while China is a semi-feudal country and not a completely feudal nation, the importance of the Chinese Revolution should be placed on national unity and unification first before the social revolution. It is the platform of the CSP-Orthodox wing to work with the Chinese Kuomintang in order to establish a leading vanguard of intellectuals and leaders to lead China into the transition from the first to the second stage.

name: Groundwork for the Proletarian Future
description: In order to elide the contradictions between the Marxist theory of worker-peasant alliance and the reality of such an alliance, we must equate the notion of the syndicalist movement with the working class, and for the leadership of the peasant movement with the proletariat proper. The Party must advance its goals of creating a proletarian class of labourers as the leading position in the Party's movement as proof of inevitable proletarian hegemony.

name: Towards Devolution
description: In order to reach datong, a hierarchy of units of government from towns to regional councils, and finally to the Central Government is to exist so that regional power is distributed and is able to freely develop. This is a temporary stage, while the existence of the Party in maintaining the military and economy exists, it is necessary until the eventual abolition of government.

name: Towards a Dream of True Love
description: \"Real love cannot happen in this world, it can happen only after the revolution, in a world of Grand Harmony. There will be no distinction between rich and poor, no separation between beauty and ugly, female and male. This kind of love is what can be called true love. The gardens of freedom have not yet opened, but the victories of the future await our resolve. Resolutely smash the dreams of impossible love.\"

name: The Red Napoleon
description: The National Revolution would have been aborted once more had it not been for General Deng Yanda. The talented Deng, whose intellect and selflessness matches no other, is not only a national hero for his role in the revolution but also may be Song Qingling's most trusted voice within the Kuomintang. It is by Deng's voice, the revolution breathes, and it is with Deng's leadership that we will strive for glory.

name: Empower Rural Cooperatives
description: With the help of the Kuomintang, the Party is to help organise rural associations and cooperatives among the peasantry in order to foster the roots for a good and nurtured democracy. These cooperatives will help them realise the goals of minquan and minsheng with the help of the Party's leadership to help strengthen their revolutionary consciousness while also providing for their own needs from the risk of famines.

name: Exalt the Struggle of Pingmin
description: The Chinese Workers and Peasants form the true people of China, long oppressed by foreign imperialists, corrupt warlords, and local bullies - for their labour and lives. There is no greater and more admirable cause than that of the Chinese peasants and workers who toil, labour, and suffer under the excesses of imperialism. Now with the success of the revolution, we strive towards their full liberation.

name: In Pursuit of Datong
