description: What we strive for is the goal of datong, the great-unity and the China of the future is to be a socialist datong society. There will be no money, no warfare, no family, no prison, and no religion. From each according to his ability, to each according to his needs - the Three Principles are merely a means to reach this equal society. The Chinese National Revolution is after all not merely a political revolution but also a truly social revolution.

name: Encourage Revolutionary Thought
description: Through pamphlets, radio broadcasts, lectures, and rallies - we will encourage the youth to study Dr. Sun's Three Principles of the People and to learn about the Party's history. In the schools and universities of this nation, We must teach them to seek liberation and modernity and to break away from old superstitions. After all, this new China belongs to them.

name: Revolution by the Chinese Method
description: It is to our understanding and belief that the national revolution must be done in the Chinese method, that is the idea of the Dang Guo party state. There is no political situation akin to China's and it is only through firm leadership and organisation, was the Second Northern Expedition successful. The revolution must be done in this way until the time is ready.

name: Consolidate the WMARCA
description: During the one of the Party's most pivotal moments, it was the brave and stalwart generals of the WMARCA who had helped saved it from collapse. The National Revolutionary Army shall be made up of those in the WMARCA, to serve in fraternal and revolutionary roles as protectors of the ideals of the national revolution. Doing so will further strengthen the NRA, as an army for the Party.

name: Pingmin Zhengquan
description: The end goal of the Chinese National Revolution is socialism, the Chinese revolution exemplifies characteristics of national revolution, democratic revolution, and eventually social revolution. However this process is not a fast one and must be done in the Chinese method, democracy and socialism must be nurtured and watered by the Party's leadership so that the masses may grow to understand and become the leadership of the social revolution that is to come.

name: Heir to the Revolution
description: In the revolution's gravest hour, the reactionaries and anti-revolutionaries sought to dismantle the National Revolution but Chairman Wang has stood firm. With power now fully consolidated in the Central Committee and the Party, the Chairman may now finally seek to exercise and fulfils Dr. Sun's will.

name: Promises of a Provisional Constitution
description: The Military phase of the National Revolution has concluded and the period of political tutelage shall soon have to end. As such, before the phase of tutelage is fully concluded - according to the Chairman, it is necessary that a provisional constitution be drafted so that the rights and liberties of the people may be guaranteed as soon as possible. Inspired by the Moderates of the RCA, this constitution shall seek to cover all peoples - not just the workers and peasants.

name: The Theory of True Democracy
description: According to the Chairman's writings, \"true democracy\" is opposed to the bourgeois democracy of the capitalistic nations and the proletarian democracy of the syndicalist nations. Nor is it compatible with the concept of military rule in Nationalist China. True democracy allows the majority of the oppressed to participate in political affairs and to strive for equal opportunities in both the economic and political sphere. This is what we should aim to achieve.

name: Guide the Producer Classes
description: The Chairman believes that the democratic forces will be the key to success in winning the hearts and minds of the Chinese people during the National Revolution. These forces will be made up of the producer classes, that is those of the workers, peasants, intellectuals, students, and other occupations. It is through the leadership of the Party, that these classes would strive for democracy for their own interests - helping China as a whole democratise.

name: Towards Local Self-Government
description: According to the Chairman, local self government begins when the Party helps to organise occupational groups made up of the local peasantry, workers, and petite bourgeoisie. These groups are then encouraged to set up local assemblies where they could help reflect their communities' best interests and advance in fulfilling shared goals with each other through this effective system of close cooperation.

name: The Federalist Compromise
description: There are certainly many within the Party who will never forgive Chen Jiongming and his Federalists for nearly jeopardising the life of our late leader and the revolution. Yet, however the PIP has shown that they are willing to work with us and the Chairman is pragmatic enough to invite them to partake in the national revolution. Let us seek to put aside petty differences for the sake of the greater goal - the goal of national democracy.

name: Concept of the Exceptional Individual
description: Unlike the Radicals, the Moderates of the RCA do not believe in social or economic environments in driving history but rather the will of the individual. Revolutionaries should not place blind faith in the masses but rather should take it upon exceptional individuals, leaders such as Chairman Wang, to lead the masses in the revolution. The quality of individuals in the national revolution dictates whether or not the revolution will succeed or fail.

name: Ensure the Four Basic Rights
description: It was the late leader's idea that the Chinese people and masses would be able to utilise the four rights of election, recall, referendum, and initiative. The Party is to play a great role in this process, by aiding and training the masses to exercise these rights. When the people are capable of doing so - minquan will be realised and democracy will naturally occur.

name: Initiate the Training of Democracy
description: Concepts like the \"Four Rights\", \"Federalism\", and \"Minquan\" are unknown to much of the country that is still illiterate or extremely poor. The Party seeks to rectify this by promoting revolutionary educational and vocational training to help train the masses for democracy and to instruct the people on the rights they are born with. Political discourse should be encouraged in order to encourage participation in the political sphere.

name: Democracy with Chinese Characteristics
description: Democracy is not an easy objective to reach in the context of the Chinese political situation but perhaps the Kuomintang can help accelerate this process by adopting the goals and strengths of the Federal Project. By working to decentralise power and to grow local governments under the leadership of the Party, we will seek to fulfil the dreams and ideals of both the late Dr. Sun Yat-sen and Chen Jiongming.

name: The Necessity of Dangguo
description: While the Chairman is committed to a platform of democracy, democracy must be nurtured and watered with the guidance of the Party. The Party is effective in weeding out anti-revolutionaries and is the embodiment of the oppressed peoples, as such it is capable of leading people in the revolutionary struggle. Furthermore, the people have lived too long under autocratic rule and as such, the Party is needed to guide them and prepare them for democracy to come.

name: Summon the National Convention
description: The Kuomintang has last met in the Third National Congress but the Chairman has ordered that a National Convention be convened soon to gather various republican parties, the army, and mass organisations - to  work towards preparing the country to end tutelage. The National Convention traces its origins to Dr. Sun's own attempts to meet with the Beiyang Government and as such in accordance with the late leader's teachings, we must aim to do the same.

name: Empowering the Presidential Camarilla
description: The events of the Third Congress showed the Chairman, that factionalism within the Party only seeks to cripple and destabilise the Party rather than uphold it. It is only fitting that power is delegated regionally to those who have been with Wang since the very beginning - those who know him best and whom he trusts no matter what. As such, the bureaucracy of the Party shall be staffed by those within Wang's inner circle.

name: Subvert the RCA
description: Long has the Reorganised Comrades Association been a thorn in the progress of our Chairman's revolution. Their talks of revolution, of Marxism, of historical materialism do nothing but further divide our Party and their stance on class struggle is contrary to the ideals set before us by the Guofu - as the late leader believed that the revolution should be for all people not just the workers. It is due time, that we help put the RCA in its place.

name: Pursue the Deradicalisation Line
description: Since the Party's founding, the Party has been committed to a policy of anti-imperialism. Yet while we supported the turn to the Left during the 1924 Reorganisation of the Party, the masses of the national revolution ought to be controlled rather than encouraged. In order to prevent the excesses of revolution, let us seek to tone down the anti-imperialist and revolutionary rhetoric.

name: Technocratic Administration
description: The Party is in need of serious reform and the bureaucrats of the Party's administrations must be swapped in favour of those with more moderate stances than those of the RCA-Radicals. Radicalism threatens to destroy everything that we have built and we should do well to rectify this by employing intellectuals and politicians who are good at what they do - rather than mere ideologues.

name: Treasure the Memory of the Guofu
description: Dr. Sun Yat-sen, the revolutionary pioneer, brilliant statesman, generalissimo, teacher, philosopher, and eternal premier - is truly the Guofu of this country. While he was unable to witness himself the success of the Northern Expedition, let us remember forever that it is with Dr. Sun's ideals that we carry out the nature of revolution and have shown that his methods are indeed necessary to achieve victory.

name: No Reconstruction Without Peace
description: Chen Bijun or Madame Wang has written that there can be no effective National Reconstruction until there is Peace in this country. As long as subversive elements and reactionary dissidents exist within the Party - there will be no peace, no harmony within the Party's functions. It is thus the duty of the Residence Faction to ensure that the Party is cleansed of what must be removed.

name: Emulate the French Education Model
description: We have learned a lot from our dear brothers and sisters of the revolutionary cause in France, including how they have handled the concepts of public education, of research universities, and of workers' education. It is fitting that in a country struggling with literacy, that we adopt educational institutions akin to those in Europe for modernisation.

name: Promise an End to Party Factionalism
description: The events of the Third National Congress have proved that the Chairman's writings are right as they showed that factionalism can truly lead to the decay and degeneration of the party. It is the duty of the Chairman and for those who support him, to end all notions of factionalism - to crush cliques and secret organisations to enforce a line of party unity.

name: The Second Sun Yat-sen
description: Within the Chinese Nationalist Party, there is none more faithful and committed to the cause and ideals of the late Dr. Sun than Wang Jingwei - his ever-loyal disciple and follower. And it has been Wang who has led the Party from near destruction into exile and then triumphant return with the success of the Second Northern Expedition and the War of Resistance. Indeed, the Chairman alone is the true successor of our late eternal premier.

name: Towards Radical Reorganisation
description: The Chairman has not forgotten the years of loyalty given to him by his trusted right-hand man Chen Gongbo. While he is not formally a member of the Reorganised Comrades Association, by empowering the Radical Faction of the RCA - the Chairman has committed himself to the platform of Chen Gongbo and his more radical ideas in dealing with the chaos of reorganising the party following the Third Congress.

name: Reorganise the Political Department
description: The Political Department of the NRA has long been nominally aligned to us over the Provisional Action Committee, giving us much needed influence within the Whampoa Military Academy - due to most of the school being loyal to PAC. With our hold secured, it is time for us to throughout reorganise the entire party. We will encourage only socialist and Marxist inspired thoughts in the Political Department to ensure that Chinese students will be the future vanguard.

name: Discipline the RCA
description: The Reorganised Comrades Association, while certainly the core base of those who align and support the legitimacy of Chairman Wang, are nonetheless too ambitious for their own good. There is no doubt that the RCA seeks to merely draw Wang away from his important matters and his own political ideology. It is imperative that we begin to crackdown on this radical movement, as their talks of revolution merely alienate popular support for the current regime.

name: The Chairman's Will
description: The recent events in Nanjing and Fujian have shown that the National Revolution is still yet to be fully secured. In order to maintain the revolutionary fervour and strength of the Second Northern Expedition, it is imperative that the Chairman's powers continue to be executive - in order to promote the effectiveness of the Party. He shall lead us with absolute power and authority as only he is fit to carry the mantle of the late Dr. Sun.

name: Lead the New Citizens Movement
description: The New Citizens Movement seeks to encourage the youth and all other oppressed groups to study the Three Principles of the People and to look towards the May 25th strikes as an example of the future. The movement will seek to incorporate the study of the Three Principles' of the People, emphasise industrial prowess, and eradicate corrupt thinking. It is from this movement, that comrades will be taught to faithfully follow and obey the will of the Chairman.

name: Achieve Workers' Democracy
description: It is the aim for the Chairman and the Reorganised Comrades Association that tutelage will come to an end one day and that there will truly be democracy in China. However, the democracy envisioned by those within the RCA is that of a democracy run by the masses - that is the workers and peasants of the Natural Revolution. Let us seek to empower unions and councils to prepare the groundwork for a revolutionary future.

name: Encourage Revolutionary Literature
description: While great orators, men like Chen Gongbo and Wang Jingwei are also praised and known for the artistic qualities as exemplified through their articles, essays, and short stories. Revolutionary journals and newspapers such as Chen's \"Revolutionary Critic\" should be required reading for the youth so that they may understand the nature of the national revolution.

name: The Chairman's Right Hand
description: Truly, Chen Gongbo is a remarkable man. There is none other within the Party that conveys his speeches and support for the Chairman's policies - than Chen Gongbo. While those who oppose him, argue that Chen is merely a modern day Cao Cao - it is undisputable that Chen is the right hand of the Chairman. The Chairman has no doubts regarding Chen Gongbo's loyalty and it is with this trust, that the RCA will be able to expand their operations farther than ever before.

name: Venerate Class Struggle
description: It is the platform of the RCA-Radicals, that class struggle is the only means of achieving social revolution and that the materialist social revolution is an inevitable result of the Chinese National Revolution. With the success of the national unification, it is only natural that we encourage the peasant and workers to rise up and break their chains so that we may draw closer to a society free of class strife.

name: Subordinate the Army to the Party
description: The Chairman believes that the Party must always be subverted to the Party. To control the Party, the Chairman has recommended that the commissariat system and political indoctrination within the army be actively used. Furthermore, all administrative decisions for the army must be made by the Party Central. The army must serve the desires of the People and the Party, in this way can years of militarism in China finally be cured.

name: Pacify the Reactionary Opposition
description: Chairman Wang has led the Kuomintang through the last several years - effectively transforming it from an exiled organisation to the Nationalist Party that has unified China according to the ideals of the late Dr. Sun. However, after the Third Congress, there have been those who have sought to dismantle everything the Chairman has built and now with the Chairman's hold secured - either amnesty or punishment must be dealt to those who have rebelled.

name: The Theatrical Revolutionary State
description: To revitalise support throughout the nation and the Party, it is imperative that the Reorganised Comrades Association incorporate elements of traditional theatrical dramas in portraying the party's history with Wang has the leading role. Through the spectacle of the arts, we will connect the glorious past of the Chinese Republic and Dr. Sun with our very own revolution of our times under Chairman Wang.

name: Our Comrades in the CSP
description: Over the years, we have participated in a rather symbiotic relationship with the League of Chinese Syndicalists and the various syndicalist groups within the league - as part of the United Front policy. With the National Revolution finally successful, the time has come to reevaluate our relationship with the Chinese Syndicalists and to perhaps sway the influence of one of their factions in order to strengthen our broad national support.

name: Nurture the Revolutionary Future
description: As the late Eternal Premier instructed us, the future belongs to the youth and the strength of the revolution depends on our care and instruction of China's next generation. Let us create a socialist youth corps, dedicated to the idea of loyalty to the Chinese nation and to the Chairman so that we may prepare the next generation to maintain the revolution.

name: Commence the National Land Reform
description: Per the instructions and doctrine left behind to us from our beloved late eternal Dr. Sun Yat-sen, the Kuomintang is to embrace the mass movement by commencing the land reform movement in order to help end feudalism and help push Chinese society towards the social revolution. RCA ideologues Gu Mengyu and Chen Gongbo have brought their unique ideas to the table and have presented their designs for the Chairman to consider as the official party agenda for land reform.

name: Revolutionary Pragmatism
description: What makes the Chairman unique amongst the leaders of the Kuomintang, is his own doctrine of revolutionary pragmatism that allows him to balance the multiple cliques within his own followers. His pragmatism is also expressed in his own ambivalence towards Chen Jiongming and the Federalists as well as his willingness to subvert the nationalistic ideals of the KMT in favour for economic and military aid from the Third Internationale.

name: The Second Reorganisation
description: Chaos and disorder reigns throughout China and pervades the Kuomintang. With the death of the Chairman but the consolidation of RCA power, it is up to Chen Gongbo to carry on the mantle of the Chairman's will. Of course... there are those who will seek to oppose him.

name: Integrate the Party with the Masses
description: The Kuomintang is to be the voice of the oppressed peoples of China from the struggling mine workers of Shandong to the rural country peasants. The Party must be integrated with the masses, the mass movement must be emphasised with members of the Party being recruited from the masses. In this way, the Party will be able to reflect the party's interests, ensuring that the Party's leadership shall be revolutionary as they come from the revolutionary classes.

name: Mold the Youth of the Future
description: The youth of the nation are going to grow up in a new China, a China vastly different from that of their parents. We must train them, teach them, and guide them to obey the Party and to accept the Party's truth as truth. We will show them that they are the vanguard of the revolution and that the revolutionary spirit shall live on in them. By taking control of the Youth Corps, we will orient them towards the revolutionary direction of Marxism.

name: Accept Class Struggle as Truth
description: Can one dispute that history shows that the revolutions are linked up with class relationships? Without the existence of class, there will be no revolution. It is ludicrous to see the people refrain from talking about class because they are afraid of inciting class struggle. At the present time, the existence of class in Chinese society is ground on objective facts - one cannot dispute that are theories are based on true facts and observations.

name: Vanguard of the Workers
description: Only the workers are capable of leading the revolution in its current iteration. For it is the workers who have built this country and have gained revolutionary consciousness in the cities, it is the workers who have the best means of organising. The KMT shall lead the workers by founding unions such as the General Trade Unions in [GetVictoryPointName_9843] and the Tangshan Railway Unions - we shall install RCA cells amongst these unions to inspire them to lead the revolution.

name: Enforce Weekly Party Member Reports
description: In order to strengthen the loyalty of all members of the RCA, by order of the Premier of the Republic of China Chen Gongbo - all mid to high level RCA members are to keep weekly reports on new and lower-ranking party members. Members are to be tracked with regard to their residences, their daily activities, and are required to attend weekly rallies and meetings to demonstrate their loyalty.

name: Revolutionary Land Reform
description: The land issue is essential to the Chinese National Revolution and the RCA-radicals have two means in how they believe this mountainous task can be achieved. There are those who believe that land must be totally confiscated by the government and then distributed to the peasants of this country. The other means is to encourage land confiscation by the peasants and to allow the peasantry to rise up and overthrow years of oppression with revolutionary violence.

name: Establish Rural and Urban Cooperatives
description: The Premier of the Republic has designs to create rural and urban cooperatives in order to foster proletarian unity and to work towards the annihilation of capitalism. Urban party members are encouraged to establish these cooperatives while rural party members are encouraged to work labour and lump their resources together - transforming small scale farming into large scale farming and to generate proletarian democracy.

name: Expel the Landlords
description: Large landowners have no place in a modern socialist society. They are the root of all evil, an extension of root and dare say capitalism into the rural heartland of the Chinese peoples. The peasants despite constituting much of the people in China are left without land despite toiling and working for it. It is only right that the Party seek to liberate them once and for all from their chains.

name: Purge the NRA
description: The National Revolutionary Army has been a hotbed of counter and anti-revolutionary activity due to the dilution of its ideology as a result of the bourgeoisie landlord officers of the India Clique, the bourgeoisie degenerates of the Reconstruction Faction, and the Bonapartists in the WMARCA. If we are to control the Party, we must ensure that the army is fully cleansed of its degenerate elements.

name: Commence the Show Trials
description: The people must know of the bourgeoisie degeneracy that pervades throughout the National Revolutionary Army. Many officers are clearly anti-revolutionaries and their presence in the Army only dilutes the true belief that the Army must belong to the people. As such, we will orchestrate trials and put them on the stand to address their crimes to the Chinese people.

name: Enforce Political Indoctrination
description: Soldiers in the National Revolutionary Army must be taught that their role is merely to play a supporting role alongside the peasants and workers of the National Revolution. We will revive the Political Department of the NRA, expanding the officer corps and enforcing that soldiers be well educated on the practices of socialism and of the great deeds of the revolutionary martyrs Dr. Sun Yat-sen and Wang Jingwei.

name: Peoples' Revolutionary Army
description: The National Revolutionary Army has been thoroughly reorganised under a new command, a new leadership, and towards a new future. While the army has always been part of the party-state, our reorganisation has placed the army completely submissive to the Party and to the people. Henceforth, what is needed is a Peoples' Revolutionary Army - a revolutionary army of peasants, workers, and soldiers in unison to pursue the national and social revolution.

name: Consolidate the Ideology of the RCA
description: If Chen Gongbo is to secure control of the Kuomintang, he must first seek to totally control the Reorganised Comrades Association. As the Radicals control much of the RCA, supporters of Chen have urged him to force the RCA to consolidate under a single ideology as to fully drive out and reduce the influence of the RCA-Moderates - thus dissolving the moderate opposition.

name: Sideline the Residence Faction
description: It's no secret that Chen Bijun and her cohort of potential reactionaries seek to destabilise the Party further and to ruin the achievements of the great late Chairman Wang. With Zeng Zhongming as the current Chairman, we should seek to use the RCA's influence in order to convince the Chairman to delegate extraordinary powers to the Premier so that the Residence Faction will not bode a threat to us.

name: Fate of the Reconstruction Faction
description: Members of the Reconstruction Faction and Sun Fo's so called \"Moderates\" are party degenerates who have long subverted and diluted the party's true ideals - they are no more than imperialists in sheep's clothing. It is merely logical that the KMT must be fully reorganised and expel the bourgeoisie and rightists in the party if it is to survive as a truly functional party organ.

name: Rein in the CSP
description: Members of the Radical Faction of the Reorganised Comrades Association have long held great ties with the Chinese Syndicalist Party, with many of our members having once been part of the CSP. In order to strengthen support for our dominance of the Party as well as to truly create a proletarian party, let us seek to fold the Radical Faction of the CSP into the Party and encourage radicals from Europe to return home and partake in national politics.

name: Fulfil the Union of Party and State
description: The Reorganised Comrades Association aims to create a truly revolutionary Central Committee one that is akin to the organisation of the prior Committee but without the supervisory committees. Furthermore, the RCA heavily emphasises the nature of obedience and training to the development of the party, only by cultivating a strong organisation will the revolution last.

name: The Great Premier
description: In the chaos of the Third National Congress, our beloved Chairman - the great Wang Jingwei unfortunately passed due to the anti-revolutionaries. In his stead, the great Premier of the Republic, Chen Gongbo has risen up and taken initiative in guiding the RCA to lead the Kuomintang forward in fulfilling the dreams and ideals of our late leaders Sun Yat-sen and Wang Jingwei. In these chaotic times, we must look to those who profess order above all.

name: Revive the Spirit of 1924
description: The Reorganisation of 1924 was a pivotal moment in our party's history in turning the Kuomintang into a truly revolutionary organisation linked with the masses as well as forming an alliance with the Chinese syndicalists in the national revolution. In order to return to those truly revolutionary times, let us seek to revive this spirit of revolution and foster good will between the KMT and the Chinese syndicalists.

name: The Party Above All
description: Members of the Reorganised Comrades Association are taught and instructed that there is nothing above the Party, members are told to disregard family ties and social bonds in favour of the party. For the party is what makes the nation strong and under the leadership of Chairman Zeng and Premier Chen, the party shall lead the nation to everlasting glory!

name: The Chairman's Last Will
description: We will never forget our great revolutionary hero and leader Wang Jingwei who has led the Party for many years and saw the dream of the National Revolution realised. Despite his life ending so violently, the Chairman had drawn up wills before for the future direction of the party. We shall read this will to the Party and carry on our comrades' great work so that the Chairman will be proud of what we have accomplished.

name: Towards a Revolutionary Future
description: With our control of the Party and government secured under the leadership of the RCA, it is time that we fully subvert the Residence Faction and convince Zeng Zhongming to peacefully step down in favour of Chen Gongbo. For it is Chen, the former Chairman's right hand, who will be able to complete the goals and ideals of the Three Principles of the People and help draw China closer towards a revolutionary future of socialism.

name: Dynamic Materialism
description: The Premier believes that economic factors are the primary movers of history and it is by economic means that Chinese history can be analysed. He has coined the term dynamic materialism and has suggested using Engels' definitions of matter and motion to explain the natural processes and mediums in which revolutions are carried out. With this concept of dynamic materialism, our socialist society shall only move forward as capitalism fades away.

name: The Revolutionary Three Principles of the People
description: Shi Cuntong, the new Premier of the Republic, is a large proponent of the idea that the Three Principles of the People be \"modified\". The revolutions in Europe and Black Monday have shown us of the inevitable demise of capitalism and as such we should seek to view Dr. Sun's teachings through a decidedly materialist world view in order to understand this new revolutionary era.

name: Revolutionary Weltanschauung
description: Weltanschauung translates to world-view and is used frequently by Chen Gongbo in describing his radical orientation and departure from orthodox Sunism. Dr. Sun's ideology can clearly be explained through Marx's interpretation and the national revolution will be followed by the social and then the cultural revolution. Through the revolution, we will change forever the shape and nature of Chinese society - bringing China ever so closer to the idea of pure communism.

name: A Second National Revolution
description: The revolution that the martyrs and late founder fought and died for - nearly came to an end due to anti-revolutionaries and foreign imperialists. With the dust finally cleared, Hu Zongnan and the China Revival Society to implement the Second Revolution to fully bring Dr. Sun's dream for a free China to reality.

name: Rally the Blueshirts!
description: The members of the China Revival Society and Revolutionary Army Comrades Association are described as the \"Blueshirts\" due to their uniforms as well as the patches they wear designating their affiliations within the KMT. Organised in a similar manner to Oswald Mosley's Blackshirts, the Blueshirts serve as our paramilitary muscle and in this time of national crisis, it is important that we rally them to help save our nation from destruction.

name: A New Order in Gannan
description: In our efforts at rural pacification, instead of pursuing a harsh stance towards the people of the country - let us instead try to reach out and endear to them via populist moral programmes to fight corruption, opium consumption, prostitution, illiteracy, and unemployment. Not only will we strengthen the moral vigour of our country but also we will receive greater support towards our leadership.

name: Reinforce the Tewu
description: Throughout China and the Party, there brings no fear greater than the Tewu or Special Services. A euphemism popularised by the forces and agents of Dai Chunfeng, the Tewu are feared throughout the country due to their new flawless executions of elaborate assassinations and their near ever so silent intelligence gathering. Due to the massive civil unrest in our country, it is only fitting that we grant the Tewu extraordinary powers and funding to secure national security.

name: Venerate the Cult of Violence
description: The current dissension towards our leadership of the Party are examples that the Party must be cleansed with the beauty of violence. We must by any means necessary, save the revolution that our late leader fought and died for. All comrades must unite together and handle all matters in accordance with this glorious principle of fighting violence with violence. In this contemporary world, morality has been destroyed and power alone is the sole measure of success.

name: Youth of a New Revolutionary Era
description: The youth of this country will be borne to a new revolutionary China, and it is our duty to ensure that the revolution continues with them. We will create youth organisations and scouting groups to encourage the youths to work together in groups and to encourage physical education in all schools. For the youth of China will be the future men and women of the National Revolutionary Army and it is important that we cultivate them into the next vanguard.

name: The Soul of National Restoration
description: The rise and fall of the nation is in direct ratio to the flourishing and decline of national culture. If we do not first establish a new national culture, then the restoration of the nation can hardly succeed. All throughout the country must be made to follow our culture - cultural control is the crux of social, political, and education activity. It is the very soul of national restoration and one that all must follow.

name: Minzu Shehuizhuyi
description: What we need first and foremost in our nation is an economic reform, one that follows the totalitarian concepts of society. Our economy shall reject the folly of capitalism and instead we demand an economy completely planned and controlled by the state. This projected system shall be known as national socialism, an ideal society in which all productivity activity shall be led by the State.

name: The Nationalisation of Education
description: China's greatest problem is education, the failure of education has caused problems within the party and the nation. We shall eliminate all local autonomy of public schools and close down private and religious states. The curricula of schools shall only feature a national education focused on Chinese culture and Chinese problems. Our goal is to foster for students, a single-minded love for their dear motherland.

name: The Industrialisation of Agriculture
description: Inspired by the doctrine of  the Russian National Populists, we advocate the vigorous development of agriculture and the improvement of agricultural technology. We shall seek to create military machine tractor stations to greatly expand agricultural output and work towards developing small rural farms into great centres of agriculture in which we will have large scale and rationalised production - bringing us closer to the industrialisation of agriculture.

name: Concept of Productivity
description: Students in society are not prepared to assume productive and useful roles in the nation, instead they become lazy and decadent unproductive members of society. Under our system of productivity, students shall be devoted to training in some form of manual labour in the factories, farms, and businesses. In this way, disdain for physical labour would be overcome and all will be a useful and productive member - working towards the success of the nation!

name: Harmonious Economy
description: The concept of National Socialism does not attack the system of private enterprise, rather it seeks to place critical areas of the economy such as heavy industry, mining, large-scale transport, and foreign trade to be managed by the state. There is to be no proscription on private profit but rather private property must be used for the benefit of society. By this method, we will seek to create a truly harmonious economy.

name: Proclaim the Permanent Purge
description: Violence as a purifying force must be used even against those persons in the Party or Government who do not measure up to the revolutionary standard. Should we continue to use tolerant methods, we can never exterminate corruption. We must create a mass violence organisation, one that shall use violence to directly attack the group of corrupt bureaucrats and other traits - to train the intellectual backward people to hate the corrupt bureaucrats who exploit them.

name: Cultivated Patronage Networks
description: The military and the leaders of the Second National Revolution are the only ones capable of handling the country's rich resources and China's industrial capacity. It is only through their leadership that China's arsenals and industries will be properly utilised for the betterment of the Chinese civilisation and nation. As such, members of the military have requested greater participation in industrial and political affairs such as managing state industries.

name: Expand the Military Pension System
description: Of all the social classes that make up Chinese society in this day and age, none contribute more to the goals of the Chinese National Revolution than that of the military. It is the military that keeps the flame of the revolution alive and it is the military in which China shall derive her strength. As such, it is imperative that we ensure that our veterans and soldiers receive adequate compensation for their sacrifices to the nation.

name: The Republic's Only Salvation
description: The China Revival Society believes that the the former Kuomintang led by Wang Jingwei was morally bankrupt and devoid of revolutionary sentiment. The Party should not be scrapped however but rather reorganised into a new organisation in which persons shall be single-mindedly committed to the revolution, and be willing to sacrifice everything for the nation and the masses and for whom material wealth holds no attraction.

name: Abolish the Legislative Yuan
description: Democracy is a degenerative disease within the party, and the perversion of liberalism within the Party's ranks has diluted the party's beliefs and ideals. Even with the Party's committee system, derived from syndicalist models - the Kuomintang's organisation must be reorganised if we are to save our country. We must strive for total obedience so there would be no inefficiencies and no hesitation - to achieve salvation for China today.

name: Eliminate Unnecessary Bureaucracy
description: The greatest defect of the Party's bureaucracy is that everyone makes excuses and blames everyone else - thereby dissipating the party's internal strength. No one acts and has soon as a meeting is called, there are disagreements. In recent months we have seen what factionalism has done, and it is our duty to ensure that the Party never again falls to such weakness. Taking inspiration from our Sorelian peers, patronage positions will be gutted and the disloyal purged.

name: Strong-arm the Legislature
description: While parliamentary democracy is certainly vile and creates factionalism (which in turn leads to unproductivity and a stagnant state), we should truly strive to realise Dr. Sun's Three Principles of the People and his calls for life, liberty, and equality. However, these qualities of democracy cannot be totally achieved until the on-going emergency is resolved. The suspended Legislative Yuan will be allowed to reconvene but under vigilant watch as we \"perfect\" Sun's vision.

name: Discipline the Bureaucracy
description: The Party must be led by those who fought and bled for the revolutionary cause - not those who discuss meaningless things like theory, materialism, and reorganisation. From the day we swore loyalty and obedience to the Party and to the Whampoa Academy, we completely entrusted our rights, life, liberty, and happiness to the group and as such we aspire that all in the Party do the same. This is how we will achieve true democracy.

name: Exalt the NRA
description: The National Revolutionary Army is the lifeline of the national revolution. In it, we entrust our lives and perform our duty for the salvation of the Chinese nation. Let us emulate the methods of the Japanese imperialists, whom while are despicable to pursue their imperialist agenda on our land, have long cultivated a tradition of sacrifice, duty, and discipline that the NRA should strive for. As such, the NRA must be above all civilian and party matters.

name: The New Three Principles of the People
description: What we seek is the pursuit for a \"new\" Three Principles of the People, a new sanminzhuyi doctrine for China's present problems. These principles shall be to strengthen national defence, to foster ultra nationalism, and to strive towards a socialist state. It is neither capitalism nor syndicalism that can save China but rather the ideals and doctrine of totalism that will help us carry out the Three Principles of the People.

name: Towards the Idea of True Freedom
description: What is freedom? Freedom is the ability for the people of this great country to relinquish their liberties, their rights, and even potentially their lives so that the nation might be free. It is indeed a heavenly principle for an individual to serve and sacrifice for the nation, a sacrificial duty of unqualified submission. When that is achieved for everyone in this nation, then we can consider our society drawing closer to the idea of true freedom.

name: National Regeneration
description: We are all the children of China, we all know that China for thousands of years is the world's premier power. Our civilisation and culture is ahead of the world and at last it time for us to reclaim our national identity from years of imperialist humiliation. Arise! Sacrifice all notions of wealth, security, and individuality, for the dedication and salvation of our glorious nation!

name: Military Syndicalism
description: The soil of China is nurtured by the blood of the martyrs of the NRA who have fought and bled for the country in the Second Northern Expedition and the War of Resistance. It is by this logic, that only the military is fit to carry on the revolution, that is the eventual total goal of socialism. Let us look to the organisational methods of the syndicalists to organise the soldiers while also strengthening military unions and alumni associations.

name: Extol the Cult of the Lingxiu
description: To attain the complete social and political national revolution, there must be a leader who possesses saintly qualities, a pure and exalted person; a man with a thorough understanding of the military and the government. The establishment of a central idol is the first step towards resurrecting China and of unifying the Kuomintang. We must not disguise that we demand China's Mussolini, demand China's Savinkov!

name: Maintain Extraordinary Powers
description: In these desperate and chaotic times, the government and country is restless as a result of the intra-party factional struggles as well as the role of foreign imperialists in subverting our stability. It is necessary that the Generalissimo's emergency powers be maintained indefinitely during this stage of tutelage so that we will have no barriers or bureaucratic means to block our lingxiu from exercising his duty.

name: The Red Generalissimo
description: In the National Revolution's darkest hour, it was the Generalissimo and his leadership of the Party that managed to save the party and the nation from destruction from anti-revolutionaries. Salvation for China today can be attained only through selflessly organising and obeying the lingxiu, trusting the policies of the Generalissimo, and implementing his orders. When we are of one mind, we become one body... there is no other way.
